What is spexwavepy

Spexwavepy is an open-source Python package dedicated to the speckle-based wavefront sensing techniques for X-ray optics. It covers a variety of X-ray speckle-based techniques, provides examples with real experiment data. This documentation will show the users how to get the spexwavepy package, where to download the shared experiment data, how to run the examples, how to build your own python code using this package, etc. We hope this python package can help the users to process the data easily.

The speckle-based wavefront sensing techniques

This part gives the brief introduction of the basic principles of various speckle-based wavefront sensing techniques.

  • The speckle-based wavefront sensing techniques

    • Conventional X-ray Speckle Tracking (XST) technique with reference beam

    • Self-reference conventional X-ray Speckle Tracking (XST) technique

    • X-ray Speckle Scanning (XSS) technique with reference beam

    • Self-reference X-ray Speckle Scanning (XSS) technique

    • X-ray Speckle Vector Tracking (XSVT) technique
